channel.title: Nerdist Writers Panel
channel.description: The Nerdist Writers Panel series is an informal chat moderated by Ben Blacker (co-creator of the Thrilling Adventure Hour; writer for Supah Ninjas, Supernatural, among others) with professional writers about the process and business of writing. Covering TV, film, comic books, music, novels, and any other kind of writing about which you'd care to hear. Proceeds from the live panels benefit 826LA, the national non-profit tutoring program.

item.title: The Signal
item.description: Will Eubank has worked as a cinematographer for years in the film industry, and now his second feature as writer/director, The Signal, is being released by Focus Features. Will talks about how he got where he is, bringing visual style to scripts, and more. The Signal is in select theaters on June 13th.

item.title: Comics Edition #45: Marvel Editors Roundtable
item.description: Executive editor Tom Brevoort; Senior Editor Nick Lowe; editors Jordan D. White, Ellie Pyle, Janeane Schaefer, Sana Anamat, and Jake Thomas; and assistant editors Xander Jarowey, Mark Basso, and Jon Moisan. Talk includes what an editor does and how to become one, one's voice as editor, what Marvel is doing right, what DC is doing right, and more.

item.title: Writers and The Law
item.description: This is not the name of a terrible TV procedural, but rather the topic of discussion with lawyer Larry Zerner and lawer-turned-TV-writer David Hudgins (Friday Night Lights). What do writers, especially beginning writers, need to know about their rights? About copyright? About contracts? These questions and more are addressed.

item.title: Comics Edition #44: Fred Van Lente
item.description: The prolific writer of Action Philosophers, Cowboys and Aliens, Incredible Hercules, Scorpion, and lots more shares stories of his long break-in period, writing for himself and various companies, and lots more.

item.title: Improvisation in TV and Film panel from C2E2
item.description:
Second City luminary Craig Cackowski (Community; Veep), and Second City alumni Mark Gagliardi and Hal Lublin (Thrilling Adventure Hour) discuss improvisation techniques and uses for aspiring actors at a panel at Chicago's C2E2. So much of this applies to writing as well—after all, what is improv but creating worlds, situations, and characters in the moment—that it seems well worth sharing.

Recorded April 27, 2014

item.title: Comics Edition #43: Rants! Edition
item.description: Heath Corson (Justice League: War) is mad as hell about Amazon's changes to Comixology; Len Wein (Wolverine; Swamp Thing; Stegron) is rip-snortin' angry about Amazing Spider-Man 2; Adam Beechen (Hench) and Ben Blacker (Thrilling Adventure Hour) are just trying to keep things calm.

item.title: Enlisted
item.description: Creator/co-showrunner Kevin Biegel (co-creator, Cougar Town) and co-showrunner Mike Royce (co-creator, Men of a Certain Age) discuss the critically beloved Fox comedy, why it's personal for them both, breaking stories, and more.

item.title: Comics Edition #42: Listener Questions Answered
item.description: Adam Beechen (Hench), Ben Blacker (Thrilling Adventure Hour), Heath Corson (Justice League: War),  and Len Wein (creator of Wolverine, Swamp Thing, and hundreds more) answer your questions about Stegron, capturing voices, and lots more.

item.title: Person of Interest
item.description: Creator/executive producer Jonathan Nolan (The Dark Knight; Interstellar) and executive producer Greg Plageman (NYPD Blue; Cold Case) sit down to talk about the hit CBS show, balancing procedural, sci-fi, and personal stories, working in the room, and more.

item.title: Comics Edition #41: Dean Trippe
item.description:
The “Project Rooftop” co-creator and the writer/artist of breakout independent graphic novel Something Terrible talks about comics as a means of autobiography, personal catharsis, and messaging, his experiences with Marvel and DC, why superheroes matter, Batman, and lots more.

Something Terrible is available for only 99 cents via http://deantrippe.com

item.title: The Children of Tendu/Nerdist Writers Panel crossover part 2!
item.description:
Ben Blacker sits down with Children of Tendu hosts Javier Grillo-Marxuatch (Helix; creator, The Middleman) and Jose Molina (Sleepy Hollow; Terra Nova) and their mentors Rene Echevarria (Star Trek: TNG/DS9; Dark Angel; Medium; Terra Nova) and Naren Shankar (Star Trek: TNG/DS9; CSI; Almost Human) to talk about room behavior, good bosses and great bosses, first scripts, and lots more.

For part 1 of the CoT/NWP crossover, go to childrenoftendu.com

item.title: Comics Edition #40: Listener Questions Answered
item.description: Marc Bernardin (The Hollywood Reporter), Ben Blacker (Thrilling Adventure Hour), and Heath Corson (Justice League: War) are joined by guest Marc Andreyko (Batwoman; the Illegitimates) to answer your questions about breaking into comics, why there are no new marquee heroes, and lots more.

item.title: New writers!
item.description: Judalina Neira (who went from the NBC writers program to being writers' assistant on Do No Harm) and Heidi Cole McAdams (who moved from development to writing for ABC's Intelligence), so-called “baby writers,” staff writers who recently have been given their first break, sit down with Ben Blacker and Wade McIntyre (Intelligence) to talk about breaking in, agents, and everything new TV writers should know.

item.title: Christopher Markus and Stephen McFeely
item.description: Christopher Markus and Stephen McFeely, writers of Captain America: Winter Soldier, Thor: The Dark World, The Chronicles of Narnia, and more, chat about their process, being architects of the Marvel Cinematic Universe, being pleasant to work with, and more.

item.title: Comics Edition #39: Marc Andreyko
item.description: The prolific writer of DC's Batwoman and Manhunter, co-writer of such books as The Illegitimates,Torso, and The Lost sits down with Marc Bernardin (The Hollywood Reporter), Ben Blacker (Thrilling Adventure Hour), and Heath Corson (Justice League: War) to talk about breaking into comics, his process, creating new characters, gay characters, and lots more.

item.title: The Scriptnotes/Nerdist Writers Panel Crossover part 2!
item.description:
Scriptnotes hosts John August (Big Fish; Frankenweenie; Go) and Craig Mazin (The Hangover 2; Identity Thief) join NWP's Ben Blacker to talk about what Craig and John are working on, their writing habits, take questions from the audience, and more.

For part one of the podcast, go to Scriptnotes: http://johnaugust.com/podcast.

item.title: Comics Edition #38: Emerald City Comic Con
item.description:
Matt Fraction (Sex Criminals; Hawkeye); Kelly Sue DeConnick (Captain Marvel; Pretty Deadly); Greg Rucka (Lazarus; Queen and Country; Gotham Central); and Cullen Bunn (Magneto; 6th Gun) join Ben Blacker (Thrilling Adventure Hour) at Seattle's Emerald City Comic con to talk craft, superheroes, and what's wrong with America.

Recorded March 28, 2014

item.title: Jonathan Groff, Rob Doherty, & Steven Maeda
item.description:
Jonathan Groff (creator, Andy Barker PI; Happy Endings; Scrubs); Rob Doherty (creator, Elementary); Steven Maeda (Helix; Pan Am; Lost; X-Files).

Recorded March 16, 2014

item.title: Comics Edition #37: Mike Costa & Ashley Miller part 2
item.description: Writer Mike Costa (GI Joe; Transformers; Blackhawks) and Ashley Miller (X-Men: First Class; Terminator reboot) sit down with Marc Bernardin (The Hollywood Reporter) and Heath Corson (Justice League: War) for a chat about writing branded characters and lots more.

item.title: Matt Walsh
item.description: UCB co-founder Matt Walsh (actor, Veep, Dog Bites Man) talks about his present project as writer/director, A Better You, which is currently running an IndieGoGo campaign to pay for post-production. Matt chats about scripting an improvised film, writing sketches, the early days of Comedy Central, and his influences.

item.title: Comics Edition #36: Mike Costa & Ashley Miller Part 1
item.description: Writer Mike Costa (GI Joe; Transformers; Blackhawks) and Ashley Miller (X-Men: First Class; Termintor reboot) sit down with Marc Bernardin (The Hollywood Reporter) and Heath Corson (Justice League: War) for a chat about their careers, writing branded characters, and lots more.

item.title: Review
item.description: Andy Daly, writer/actor Andy Blitz, and writer/director Jeffrey Blitz discuss their terrific new Comedy Central show Review. How the show was made, Andy's character “Forrest McNeil,” how episodes are broken, and the arc of the show are discussed.

item.title: Comics Edition #35: Listener Questions Answered!
item.description:
Adam Beechen (Hench), Marc Bernardin (Hollywood Reporter; Monster Attack Network), Ben Blacker (Thrilling Adventure Hour), and Heath Corson (Justice League: War) answer YOUR questions!

Have questions you want answered on the podcast? Leave them on the Nerdist Writers Panel Facebook page: Facebook.com/NerdistWritersPanel

item.title: Writers/Actors
item.description:
Clark Gregg (writer/director: Choke; Trust Me; actor: Marvel's Agents of SHIELD); Dan Bucatinsky (writer: Web Therapy; Grey's Anatomy; actor: Scandal); Liz Vassey (writer: NBC bowling pilot; actor: CSI; The Tick)

Recorded March 9, 2014

item.title: Comics Edition #34: Justice League: War!
item.description:
Justice League: War! Heath Corson's DC Direct film has finally been released! And it's really good! Adam Beechen (Hench), Marc Bernardin (Hollywood Reporter; Monster Attack Network) and Ben Blacker (Thrilling Adventure Hour)talk about how the film came together and then discuss the problems and fun of writing super-teams in general.

Have questions you want answered on the podcast? Leave them on the Nerdist Writers Panel Facebook page: Facebook.com/NerdistWritersPanel

item.title: Moira Kirland, Terry Matalas, Travis Fickett, and Douglas Petrie
item.description:
Moira Kirland (Arrow; Castle); Terry Matalas & Travis Fickett (SyFy's upcoming 12 Monkeys; Nikita; Terra Nova); and returning guest Douglas Petrie (Buffy; American Horror Story: Coven).

Recorded February 16, 2014.

item.title: Comics Edition #33: Advice to The New Writer
item.description: Ben Blacker and his writing partner Ben Acker are near to taking over writing duties on Marvel's Thunderbolts. Len Wein, Adam Beechen, and Heath Corson give their advice based upon their experiences in taking over books from existing writers and as readers invested in a book that was taken over by a new creative team.

item.title: Phillip Iscove, Dawn Prestwich, Nicole Yorkin, and Cole Haddon
item.description:
Phillip Iscove (co-creator, Sleepy Hollow); Dawn Prestwich and Nicole Yorkin (The Killing; Carnivale); Cole Haddon (creator, NBC's Dracula).

Recorded February 9, 2014.

item.title: Bryan Fuller
item.description:
The creator of Hannibal, Pushing Daisies, Wonderfalls, and Dead Like Me discusses his work habits, putting a philosophy in every scene, death, collaboration, Star Trek, and lots more.

Recorded January 19, 2014.

item.title: Comics Edition #35: Sam Humphries
item.description: Ben Blacker (Thrilling Adventure Hour) and Heath Corson (Justice League: War) sit down with writer Sam Humphries (Avengers: AI; Ultimates; Uncanny X-Force) to talk about getting started for a major company like Marvel, putting together a team book, writing to theme, and more.

item.title: Michelle Ashford, John Hamburg, and Carlos Coto
item.description: Michelle Ashford (creator, Masters of Sex); John Hamburg (Meet the Parents; Zoolander; creator, Welcome to the Captain), Carlos Coto (showrunner, From Dusk Till Dawn).

item.title: Comics Edition #31: Tony Isabella
item.description: Who co-created Black Lightning, the Champions, and Tigra in the 1970s, and wrote the indispensable book, 1000 Comic Books You Must Read? Len Wein's old pal, writer Tony Isabella, who joins Len and Adam Beechen to talk comics then and now.

item.title: John Francis Daley and Jonathan Goldstein
item.description: The writers of Horrible Bosses, John Francis Daley and Jonathan Goldstein (Burt Wonderstone; Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs 2) talk about their process, their breakthrough Blacklisted script called The $40,000 Man, learning how to pitch, their National Lampoon's Vacation reboot, and more.

item.title: Comics Edition #30: Listeners Questions Answered
item.description:
Len Wein, Heath Corson, and Ben Blacker answer questions submitted by listeners, including comic works that are the apex of the medium's storytelling, debates about creator credit, and work habits.

Have questions you want answered on the podcast? Leave them on the Nerdist Writers Panel Facebook page: Facebook.com/NerdistWritersPanel

item.title: Emmy Grinwis, Deric Hughes, and Benjamin Raab
item.description: Emmy Grinwis (MTV's upcoming Eye Candy); Deric Hughes and Benjamin Raab (Warehouse 13). A chat with up-and-coming writers about being up-and-coming writers, how they got noticed, writing and selling, and more.

item.title: Comics Edition #29: Sean Howe
item.description: Ben Blacker (Thrilling Adventure Hour), Adam Beechen (Hench), and Heath Corson (Justice League: War) sit down with journalist Sean Howe (Marvel Comics: The Untold Story) to discuss how the book came together, who participated and who didn't, and Howe's evolving relationship to comic books.

item.title: Dan Harmon, Chris McKenna, Justin Halpern, Patrick Schumacker, and Joe Henderson
item.description:
Dan Harmon (creator, Community); Chris McKenna (Community); Justin Halpern & Patrick Schumacker (creators, Surviving Jack and $#*! My Dad Says); and Joe Henderson (Graceland; White Collar).

Recorded January 12, 2014.

item.title: Comics Edition #28: Definitives Part 2
item.description: Len Wein (creator of Swamp Thing and more), Adam Beechen (Hench), and Ben Blacker (Thrilling Adventure Hour) discuss more definitives—stories, writers, and artists—including Swamp Thing, Garth Ennis, Grant Morrison, Wonder Woman, and lots more.

item.title: Karina Longworth
item.description: Former LA Weekly and Village Voice film critic Karina Longworth (Masters of Cinema: George Lucas) discusses her new book, Meryl Streep: Anatomy of an Actor, authorial voice in criticism, and what makes movies good.

item.title: Comics Edition #27: Comics in other media, 2013
item.description: Marc Bernardin (Hollywood Reporter) joins Adam Beechen (Hench) and Heath Corson (Justice League: War) to talk about comic characters in other media and how they fared in 2013, including discussions of Man of Steel, Marvel's Agents of SHIELD, Thor 2, and more.

item.title: Kurt Sutter
item.description:
The Sons of Anarchy creator is joined by SoA superfans Jessica Goldstein (Cougar Town) and Paul Grellong (Revolution) to discuss how the show is put together, his work on The Shield, and more.

Recorded live at Meltdown on December 8, 2013. Lots of live panels coming up! Go to https://nerdmeltla.com/tickets2/ and look for the big orange logo! All live panels benefit 826LA.

item.title: Comics Edition #26:2013 in Review
item.description: Len Wein (creator of Wolverine and lots more), Adam Beechen (Hench), Ben Blacker (Thrilling Adventure Hour), and Heath Corson (Justice League: War) discuss the year in comics—the big stories, their favorite books and writers.

item.title: TV Year in Review part 2
item.description: TV Year in Review part 2 with Josh Friedman (Avatar sequel; creator, Sarah Connor Chronicles), Jeff Greenstein (director, Mom; Will & Grace), and Cathryn Humphris (Elementary).

item.title: TV Year in Review part 1
item.description: With Hart Hanson (creator, Bones), Andrew Miller (creator, Secret Circle), and Aaron Ginsburg (Finder; Intelligence).

item.title: Comics Edition #25: Definitives
item.description: Len Wein (creator of Wolverine), Adam Beechen (Hench), and Ben Blacker (Thrilling Adventure Hour) discuss who are the definitive writers and artists for certain characters, and what story can be considered a character's “definitive” story.

item.title: Directors panel from ATX, an Austin TV Festival
item.description:
Featuring Tom Verica (Scandal), Dave Semel (American Horror Story), and Rob Schrab (Childrens Hospital). A look at directors of episodic television. They say that TV is a writer’s medium…as opposed to film that is a director’s medium. If that’s true, then what does that mean for the director of a TV series? Hear from veteran and new directors of episodic television on how they manage, what they see their role as, the rewards, and the struggles of directing television. Moderated by Emily Moss Wilson.

Recorded at ATX 2013.

item.title: Austin Film Festival
item.description: Ashley Miller (Thor; X-Men: First Class), Kelly Marcel (Saving Mr. Banks; 50 Shades of Gray); and Kell Cahoon (Psych; Just Shoot Me; NewsRadio). Recorded live at the Austin Film Festival on October 24, 2013.

item.title: Comics Edition #24: Mike Carlin
item.description: Adam Beechen (Hench) and Heath Corson (Justice League: War) sit down with DC's Mike Carlin to discuss his work on their animated projects, his long career as an editor, his work as a writer and an artist, that time when Superman died and it was a big deal, and why time travel stories inevitably suck.

item.title: Mark Protosevich
item.description: Mark Protosevich (The Cell; I Am Legend) talks about adapting Oldboy—directed by Spike Lee, in theaters this week—from the Korean original, feature adaptations, and lots more.

item.title: Comics Edition #23: Adam Glass
item.description: Ben Blacker (Thrilling Adventure Hour) and Heath Corson (Justice League: War) sit down with television and comic book writer Adam Glass (Supernatural; Flashpoint: Legion of Doom) to talk about writing in different media, writing for villains, and the particular appeal of the Suicide Squad.

item.title: Welcome to Night Vale
item.description:
Recorded at NY Comic Con, it's a look behind the curtain of the mega-popular podcast, Welcome to Night Vale with creator Joseph Fink, co-writer Jeffrey Cranor, voice of Night Vale radio Cecil Baldwin, and guest star Mara Wilson.

Plus: Correspondent Liz Hara interviews master puppet builder Rollie Krewson at the Sesame Street workshop. And, a HostGator ad!

item.title: Comics Edition #22: Comic Book Heroes
item.description: Adam Beechen (Hench), Ben Blacker (Thrilling Adventure Hour), and Heath Corson (Justice League: War) chat about who their comic book writer heroes were growing up and what happened when they got to meet them.

item.title: The Colbert Report
item.description: Head-writer Opus Moreschi (Craig Kilborn; Li'l Bush) and writers Eric Drysdale (The Daily Show), Nate Charny, Michael Brumm, Meredith Scardino, and Aaron Cohen discuss how the show is put together, writing jokes, and just how good Stephen Colbert really is. Sitting in on the discussion is NBC Sports field producer Lena Moss.

item.title: Comics Edition #21: Greg Rucka
item.description: Ben Blacker (Thrilling Adventure Hour) sits down in New York traffic with superstar writer Greg Rucka (Whiteout; Gotham Central; Lazarus) to talk about his interest in crime fiction, the myth of the unflawed hero, learning as you go, and lots more.

item.title: Sesame Street
item.description: Head-writer/puppeteer Joey Mazzarino and writers John Weidman, Christine Ferraro, Belinda Ward, and Molly Boylan tell Ben how to get, how to get to Sesame Street in this bonus-sized episode which also includes a visit to the Muppet Workshop and brief interviews with puppet wrangler Lara McLean, costumer Connie Peterson, and puppet designer Rollie Krewson.

item.title: Comics Edition #20: Kelly Sue DeConnick
item.description: Ben Blacker (Thrilling Adventure Hour) chats with writer Kelly Sue DeConnick (Captain Marvel; Avengers Assemble; Pretty Deadly) about where are the female comics writers are, working with artists, picking and choosing genre tropes, and lots more.

item.title: Actors Roundtable
item.description: “Actors Roundtable” from ATX Television Festival: Some of today’s leading episodic actors talk about the ups and downs of their TV careers. With Joshua Malina (Scandal), Lucas Neff (Raising Hope), Scott Porter (Friday Night Lights), Matt Lauria (Friday Night Lights), Devon Gummersall (My So-Called Life), Nick Wechsler (Revenge, Roswell), Wilson Bethel (Hart of Dixie). Moderated by Evan Miller. Recorded at the Stephen F. Austin Hotel ballroom in Austin, TX, on June 9, 2013.

item.title: Comics Edition #19: Marc Bernardin
item.description: Heath Corson (Justice League: War) chats with TV/comics writer and journalist Marc Bernardin (Alphas; Static Shock; The Hollywood Reporter) about the ups and downs of writing for comics, tv and magazines as well as Jim Lee vs. the power of tenacity.

item.title: Showrunners & Creators
item.description: Showrunners and Creators panel from ATX Television Festival. Michael Rauch, Andrew Lenchewski, Dmitry Lipkin, Tim Doyle, Kevin Biegel, Mike Royce, Dan Bucatinsky. Moderated by Andrew Miller.

item.title: Comics Edition #18: Kyle Higgins
item.description: Adam Beechen chats with writer Kyle Higgins (Nightwing; Batman Beyond) about working for DC, how Kyle got started, and writing for the Bat-universe.

item.title: Michael Jacobs
item.description:
Michael Jacobs' first foray into TV was a home run with creation of the iconic '80s series Charles in Charge, and he didn't stop there, as he went on to create some of the most recognizable series in the 1980s and 1990s: My Two Dads, The Torkelsons, Dinosaurs, and Boy Meets World. He also produced the four-time Oscar nominated feature film Quiz Show (about the 1950s TV quiz show scandal). Now Michael is back with the highly anticipated series Girl Meets World, which will reunite Cory and Topanga from Boy Meets World and take a look on how their daughter handles adolescence. In conversation with Robyn Ross (TVGuide.com), Michael relives his journey in television, from creating and writing to his wealth of stories of the industry, talent, and TVs history.

Recorded at ATX Television Festival in the Stephen F. Austin ballroom in Austin, TX, on June 6, 2013.

item.title: Comics Edition #17: Ashley Miller Part 2
item.description: Adam Beechen continues the conversation with screenwriter Ashley Miller (X-Men: First Class; upcoming: Fantastic Four) about adapting comics for the screen.

item.title: Mythology
item.description:
Mythology panel from ATX Television Festival. Remi Aubuchon (creator, Caprica), Richard Hatem (Grimm; The Gates), Jane Espenson (Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Battlestar Galactica, Once Upon a Time), Dmitry Lipkin (creator, The Riches and Hung), and Winnie Holzman (creator, My So-Called Life) discuss creating the world and rules of a show.

Moderated by Todd VanDerWerff (AV Club).

Recorded at the Stephen F. Austin Hotel in Austin, TX, on June 7, 2013.

item.title: Comics Edition #16: Ashley Miller Part 1
item.description: Comics Edition #16: Ashley Miller part 1: Thor! Ben Blacker has a lot of questions about Miller's adaptation of Thor (2009), Marvel's resident god. Adam Beechen does his best to reign everyone in. Like Odin would do.

item.title: Enlisted
item.description: BONUS EPISODE: Enlisted panel from ATX Television Festival. All about the new Fox army sibling comedy, with its creator Kevin Biegel (co-creator, Cougar Town), executive producer Mike Royce (Men of  a Certain Age), and stars Geoff Stults, Chris Lowell, Parker Young, and Angelina Cabral.

item.title: Once Upon A Time
item.description:
Once Upon a Time creators Adam Horowitz and Eddy Kitsis, recorded at ATX Television Festival.

Recorded at the Alamo Drafthouse in Austin, TX, on June 8, 2013.

item.title: Comics Edition #15: Non-Comics Readers
item.description: Comics Edition #16: Non-comics readers. Ben Blacker and Heath Corson sit down with Blacker's wife, Julie Lacouture, and actress Jenny Wade (Reaper) to discuss comics from a non-comics-reader's perspective, barriers to entry, and fandom in general.

item.title: Structure of a Sitcom
item.description:
“Structure of a Sitcom and Rise of the Anti-Sitcom” panel from ATX Television Festival: Dan Harmon (creator, Community), Paul Scheer (creator, NTSF:SD:SUV), Dave Finkel (New Girl; 30 Rock), Tim Doyle (Last Man Standing), and Rob Schrab (director, Mindy Project, Childrens Hospital) discuss the rise of new-comedy formats and the changing rules of writing comedy.

Moderated by Emily Moss Wilson.

item.title: Comics Edition #14: Clone
item.description: Comics Edition #15: Clone. Ben Blacker chats with creator David Schulner (Do No Harm) and writers Aaron Ginsburg & Wade McIntyre (Intelligence) about the Skybound series, making the leap from TV to comics, and more.

item.title: Ghost Girls
item.description: A chat with the writers/creators of the awesome and hilarious new Yahoo series, Amanda Lund, Maria Blasucci, and Jeremy Konner (Drunk History). The 12-episode paranormal procedural was directed by Konner and co-produced by Jack Black's Electric Dynamite and Shine America. It debuted yesterday. It is seriously great.

item.title: Comics Edition #13: Christos Gage
item.description: Comics Edition #13: Christos Gage! Adam Beechen (Hench) and Ben Blacker (Thrilling Adventure Hour) sit down with writer Christos Gage to talk about working for Marvel and smaller publishers, Avengers Academy, company crossovers, developing characters, and lots more!

item.title: ATX Television Festival
item.description:
Pitch-Pilot-Pick Up panel from ATX Television Festival: Julie Plec (showrunner, Vampire Diaries; co-creator/showrunner, The Originals), Liz Tigelaar (creator, Life Unexpected), Kyle Killen (creator, Mind Games, Awake, and Lone Star), Chris Keyser (creator, Party of Five), Bryan Seabury (VP Drama Development at CBS), Corey Marsh (Manager of Current Programming at Disney Channel), and Charlie Ebersol (producer, the Hochberg Ebersol Co.) discuss the beginning stages of a TV series from the pitch, to filming the pilot, to finally waiting on pins and needles to hear if a pilot was given a shot to make it into your living rooms.

Recorded at the Stephen F. Austin Hotel in Austin, TX, on June 8, 2013.

item.title: Comics Edition #12: Alan Burnett
item.description: Comics edition #12: Alan Burnett (Batman: TAS; Mask of the Phantasm; Green Lantern: Emerald Knights). Heath Corson (Justice League: War) and Ben Blacker (Thrilling Adventure Hour) sit down with WB producer/writer Alan Burnett, who has had a hand in virtually every DC animated project since Super Friends.

item.title: Veronica Mars
item.description:
Veronica Mars's Rob Thomas and Chris Lowell, live from ATX Television Festival.

Recorded at the Stephen F. Austin Hotel ballroom in Austin, TX, on June 9, 2013.

item.title: Davey Holmes
item.description: BONUS EPISODE: An in-depth chat with Davey Holmes (Awake; Shameless; Law & Order; Pushing Daisies) about his 2013 pilot Boomerang, pitching, finding your voice, and more. (Note: this interview was recorded before the network upfronts, so Boomerang's fate was still undecided. Ultimately Fox didn't pick up the show to series).

item.title: Jaws
item.description:
The Jaws Summer Special! End your summer talking Jaws, comedy, and more with Jaws screenwriter Carl Gottlieb (The Smothers Brothers; The Jerk) and Jaws enthusiast Paul F. Tompkins (Comedy Bang Bang).

Recorded live at Nerdmelt on August 4, 2013.

item.title: Comics Edition #11: Dan Slott
item.description: Comics edition #11: Dan Slott. An in-depth chat with the writer who replaced Spider-Man's brain with Doc Ock's! We talk about Amazing Spider-Man, Superior Spider-Man, Avengers: Initiative, She-Hulk, and lots more. Recorded in a cafe in New York, NY in May 2013. There's quite a bit of background noise here, but Dan is so interesting, that we had to release it!

item.title: Comedy Bang Bang!
item.description:
Comedy Bang Bang! From ATX Television Festival, a chat with CBB creator and Earwolf network co-founder Scott Aukerman (Between Two Ferns) and CBB's head writer Neil Campbell.

Recorded at the Alamo Drafthouse in Austin, TX, on June 8, 2013.

item.title: Comics Edition #10: Watchmen
item.description: Comics edition #10: All about Watchmen with Len Wein, who edited Alan Moore's original series, and co-hosts Adam Beechen (Hench) and Heath Corson (Justice League DC Direct movie).

item.title: Vince Gilligan, Greg Daniels, Carlton Cuse, and Liz Meriweather
item.description:
100th episode spectacular! Live from Largo at the Coronet, in conjunction with Fast Company magazine, an all-star line-up with Vince Gilligan (creator, Breaking Bad), Greg Daniels (creator, King of the Hill; developer, the Office; co-creator, Parks and Recreation); Carlton Cuse (Lost; Bates Motel; The Strain; creator, Nash Bridges); Liz Meriweather (creator, the New Girl); with TV-inspired songs by Sara Watkins!

Recorded at Largo at the Coronet on June 4, 2013 as an event sponsored by Fast Company magazine to benefit 826LA, the national non-profit tutoring program. Pick up Sara Watkins' newest album, Sun Midnight Sun, on iTunes or at SaraWatkins.com. It's really good.

item.title: Comics Edition #9: Fanship and Creators' Responsibility
item.description: Comics edition #9: Hosts Len Wein (creator of Wolverine, Swamp Thing, and hundreds more), Adam Beechen (Hench, Batman Beyond), Ben Blacker (Thrilling Adventure Hour; Wolverine: Season One), and Heath Corson (Aim High; Scary Godmother) discuss fanship and creators' responsibility to fans, including the Veronica Mars movie, the (first) death of Robin, killing characters, and more.

item.title: Kevin Heffernan and Steve Lemme
item.description: A fun chat with writers/comics/actors/producers Kevin Heffernan and Steve Lemme of comedy brand Broken Lizard (Supertroopers; Beer Fest). Check out Kevin and Steve's new webseries at http://www.brokenlizard.com/

item.title: Comics Edition #8: SDCC 2013 Wrap Up
item.description: Comics edition #8: SDCC 2013 wrap up with Len Wein (creator of Wolverine, Swamp Thing, and hundreds more), Ben Blacker (Thrilling Adventure Hour; Wolverine: Season One), and Heath Corson (upcoming: Justice League: War; Aim High).

item.title: Arthur Phillips
item.description: #98 An in-depth chat with author Arthur Phillips (The Tragedy of Arthur; The Egyptologist; Prague) about Shakespeare, making work of writing, unreliable narrators, and more. Recorded at a cafe in Brooklyn on May 11, 2013. There is a lot of background noise in this interview! You are warned! It gets a bit better halfway through, but Arthur had such great things to say, that we wanted to make sure this got to you, dear listener.

item.title: Comics Edition #7: Joshua Fialkov
item.description: Comics edition #7: An in depth conversation with Joshua Fialkov (I, Vampire; Tumor; Echos; Elk's Run).

item.title: Nerdist Writers Panel #97: JG Quintel and Alex Hirsch
item.description:
JG Quintel (creator, The Regular Show); Alex Hirsch (creator, Gravity Falls).

Recorded May 19, 2013. As of today The Regular Show seasons 1 and 2 are available on DVD and Blu ray!

item.title: Comics Edition #6: San Diego Comic Con
item.description: Comics edition #6: Get ready for San Diego Comic Con as Heath gives us the lowdown on 2012's MorrisonCon, and we talk about convention experiences as fans and guests.

item.title: The Lizzie Bennet Diaries
item.description: The team behind the Lizzie Bennet Diaries, including co-creator Bernie Su, writers Margaret Dunlap, Rachel Kiley, and Kate Rorick, and writer/transmedia mastermind Jay Bushman.

item.title: Comics edition #5: Celebrate Independence Day
item.description: Comics edition #5: Celebrate Independence Day with hosts Len Wein (creator of Wolverine, Swamp Thing, and hundreds more), Adam Beechen (Hench, Batman Beyond), Ben Blacker (Thrilling Adventure Hour; Wolverine: Season One), and Heath Corson (Aim High; Scary Godmother) as they talk all about Captain America. And Bucky too!

item.title: Rebecca Sinclair, Greg Malins and Mark O’Keefe
item.description: Rebecca Sinclair (90210; Gilmore Girls; Buffy), Greg Malins (Friends; How I Met Your Mother; 2 Broke Girls), and Mark O’Keefe (The Weird Al Show; News Radio; Bruce Almighty). Recorded March 24, 2013.

item.title: Comics Edition #4: Wolverine Season One
item.description:
Comics Edition #4: Celebrating the release of Wolverine: Season One, written by Ben Acker & Ben Blacker. Adam Beechen hosts, Wolverine creator Len Wein weighs in, and NWP Comics Edition co-host Heath Corson wears a tuxedo.

Recorded live at Meltdown Comics in Hollywood on June 6, 2013.

item.title: Greg Daniels, Jessica Goldstein, and Chrissy Pietrosh
item.description:
Greg Daniels (developer, The Office; co-creator, Parks and Recreation; creator, King of the Hill); Jessica Goldstein and Chrissy Pietrosh (Cougar Town; My Name Is Earl).

Recorded April 28, 2013.

item.title: Comics edition #3: Glen Weldon
item.description:
Comics edition #3: An in-depth conversation with comics journalist Glen Weldon (Superman: The Unauthorized Biography).

With hosts Len Wein (creator of Wolverine, Swamp Thing, and hundreds more), Adam Beechen (Hench, Batman Beyond), Ben Blacker (Thrilling Adventure Hour; Wolverine: Season One), and Heath Corson (Aim High; Scary Godmother).

item.title: Carlton Cuse, Michael Schur, and JJ Philbin
item.description:
Carlton Cuse (Bates Motel; Lost; The Strain); Michael Schur (co-creator, Parks and Recreation); JJ Philbin (New Girl; The OC; Gilmore Girls).

Recorded April 21, 2013

item.title: Comics Edition #2: Delving deep into comics characters' psychology
item.description: Comics edition #2: Delving deep into comics characters' psychology, featuring Batman (of course), the Hulk and...Richie Rich? Plus. Sean Howe's Marvel Comics: the Untold Story, and other stuff we're reading right now. With hosts Len Wein (creator of Wolverine, Swamp Thing, and hundreds more), Adam Beechen (Hench, Batman Beyond), Ben Blacker (Thrilling Adventure Hour; Wolverine: Season One), and Heath Corson (Aim High; Scary Godmother).

item.title: Graham Yost, creator and showrunner of Justified
item.description:
Graham Yost, creator and showrunner of Justified.

As part of Fast Company magazine's “Most Creative People” issue, Ben Blacker interviewed the showrunners and creators of some of television's most interesting and groundbreaking shows about how they're carving out new territory in the business and creative worlds, and how these creatives are driving the zeitgeist. The issue is online http://www.fastcompany.com/most-creative-people/ and on newsstands now.

item.title: Comics Edition #1
item.description: Comics Edition #1: Hosts Len Wein (creator of Wolverine, Swamp Thing, and hundreds more), Adam Beechen (Hench, Batman Beyond), Ben Blacker (Thrilling Adventure Hour; Wolverine: Season One), and Heath Corson (Aim High; Scary Godmother) are off to the races talking about the specific language of comic book scriptwriting, the role of the editor, collaborating with artists, and more.

item.title: Howard Gordon, co-creator of Homeland
item.description:
Howard Gordon, co-creator of Homeland, executive producer of three 2013 pilots.

As part of Fast Company magazine's “Most Creative People” issue, Ben Blacker interviewed the showrunners and creators of some of television's most interesting and groundbreaking shows about how they're carving out new territory in the business and creative worlds, and how these creatives are driving the zeitgeist. The issue is online http://www.fastcompany.com/most-creative-people// and on newsstands now.

item.title: Ian Roberts and Jay Martel, showrunners of Key & Peele
item.description:
BONUS EPISODE with Ian Roberts and Jay Martel, showrunners of Key & Peele.

As part of Fast Company magazine's “Most Creative People” issue, Ben Blacker interviewed the showrunners and creators of some of television's most interesting and groundbreaking shows about how they're carving out new territory in the business and creative worlds, and how these creatives are driving the zeitgeist. The issue is online now at http://www.fastcompany.com/most-creative-people/  and is available on newsstands next week.

item.title: Vince Gilligan, creator and showrunner of Breaking Bad
item.description:
Vince Gilligan, creator and showrunner of Breaking Bad.

As part of Fast Company magazine's “Most Creative People” issue, Ben Blacker interviewed the showrunners and creators of some of television's most interesting and groundbreaking shows about how they're carving out new territory in the business and creative worlds, and how these creatives are driving the zeitgeist. The issue is online http://www.fastcompany.com/most-creative-people/ and on newsstands now.

item.title: Callie Khouri, creator of Nashville
item.description:
BONUS EPISODE with Callie Khouri, creator of Nashville.

As part of Fast Company magazine's “Most Creative People” issue, Ben Blacker interviewed the showrunners and creators of some of television's most interesting and groundbreaking shows about how they're carving out new territory in the business and creative worlds, and how these creatives are driving the zeitgeist. The issue is online http://www.fastcompany.com/most-creative-people/ and on newsstands now.

item.title: Jason Fuchs
item.description: An in-depth chat with Jason Fuchs about the work he did on the ABC/Disney pilot Big Thunder, the animated feature Ice Age: Continental Drift, being a child actor, and lots more. (Note: this interview was recorded before the network upfronts, so Big Thunder's fate was still undecided. Ultimately ABC didn't pick up the show to series).

item.title: Liz Meriweather, Brett Baer and Dave Finkel, creator and showrunners of the New Girl
item.description:
Liz Meriweather, Brett Baer and Dave Finkel, creator and showrunners of the New Girl.

As part of Fast Company magazine's “Most Creative People” issue, Ben Blacker interviewed the showrunners and creators of some of television's most interesting and groundbreaking shows about how they're carving out new territory in the business and creative worlds, and how these creatives are driving the zeitgeist. The issue is online http://www.fastcompany.com/most-creative-people/ and on newsstands now.

item.title: Adam F. Goldberg
item.description: An in-depth chat with Adam F. Goldberg about his varied writing career on such projects as indie feature Fanboys, childrens' entertainments The Muppets Wizard of Oz and WordGirl, network comedies Breaking In, Community, and others, and his new pilot, The Goldbergs.

item.title: Ryan Condal
item.description: An in-depth chat with Ryan Condal who is currently adapting the comic series The 6th Gun for NBC and Hercules: The Thracian Wars for Paramount, MGM, and director Brett Ratner.

item.title: Nicholas Falacci, Cheryl Heuton, Taylor Elmore and Michael Gilvary
item.description: Nicholas Falacci and Cheryl Heuton (creators, Numb3ers), Taylor Elmore (Justified), and Michael Gilvary (Chicago Fire; Breakout Kings). Recorded March 17, 2013.

item.title: Celebrating Husbands, the comic!
item.description:
The creators of Husbands, the series, Jane Espenson (Once Upon a Time; Buffy; Caprica) and Brad Bell (“Cheeks”), have written a wonderful series for Dark Horse Comics, and it is finally released in collected, hardcover form! Join Jane, Brad, and Husbands co-star Sean Hemeon as they discuss bringing their web-series creation to comics, the next season of Husbands, stage a reading from the comic, and more!

Recorded April 14, 2013.

item.title: Writers of Kroll Show
item.description: An in depth chat with the writers/directors/creators of Comedy Central's Kroll Show, Nick Kroll, Jonathan Krisel, and John Levenstein, about bringing characters to TV, building worlds, what's funny, and lots more. Recorded March 10, 2013.

item.title: Andy Bobrow, Emily Halpern, Gideon Yago and Max Winkler
item.description: Andy Bobrow (Community; Malcolm in the Middle); Emily Halpern (The Unit; Private Practice); Gideon Yago (The Newsroom); Max Winkler (writer/director, Ceremony; director, New Girl, New Normal). Recorded February 17, 2013.

item.title: Bob Harris
item.description: A chat with author Bob Harris (Prisoner of Trebekistan) about his new book on micro-loans The International Bank of Bob. We talk about doing good to feel good, emotional writing, the business of books, advice from Joss Whedon, and lots more. Check out Bob's book at http://bank-of-bob.com/

item.title: Joe Port and Joe Wiseman
item.description: An in-depth interview with Joe Port and Joe Wiseman (Dilbert; Son of the Beach; Just Shoot Me) about their new, autobiographical pilot Joe and Joe and Jane, their writing partnership, what's funny, and lots more.

item.title: Bill Prady, Donick Cary and Stephen Scaia
item.description: Bill Prady (co-creator, The Big Bang Theory); Donick Cary (New Girl; Bored to Death; former head-writer, Late Show with David Letterman); Stephen Scaia (Human Target; Jericho; adapting Y: The Last Man for feature film). Recorded February 10, 2013.

item.title: Live from the Jonathan Coulton Cruise!
item.description:
Live from the Jonathan Coulton Cruise! Bill Corbett (Rifftrax; Mystery Science Theater 3000) hosts author John Scalzi (Old Man’s War), singer/songwriter John Roderick (The Long Winters), Josh Cagan (Geek and Sundry's Learning Town), web-comic wrier/artist Randall Munroe (XKCD), writer/comedian Joseph Scrimshaw (Comedy of Doom), singer/songwriter Molly Lewis, and guitarist/songwriter Adam Bernstein. Recorded aboard the “Freedom of the Seas” Royal Caribbean ship for JoCo Cruise Crazy 3 on February 15, 2013.

Bill would like to thank Sara Scrimshaw who volunteered to record this panel, and I (Ben) would like to thank Bill for offering it for podcast!

item.title: Leslye Headland
item.description: An in-depth chat with writer/director Leslye Headland (Bachelorette) about movies, plays, working on FX's Terriers, David Mamet, and her new pilot, Assistance.

item.title: Live from San Francisco!
item.description: Live from San Francisco! Michael Chabon (The Amazing Adventures of Kavalier and Clay; Telegraph Avenue); Glen David Gold (Carter Beats the Devil; Sunnyside); Erik Larsen (Savage Dragon; co-founder of Image Comics); Joshua Davis (The Underdog).

item.title: Nerdist Comics Panel backdoor pilot
item.description: Nerdist Comics Panel backdoor pilot. The spin-off podcast is coming soon. For now, enjoy this chat with its hosts Ben Blacker, Len Wein (creator of Wolverine, Swamp Thing, and hundreds of other favorite characters), Adam Beechen (Batman Beyond, Hench; animation including Teen Titans, Voltron Force, and lots more), and Heath Corson (web-series Aim High; upcoming, top-secret WB animated films).

item.title: Robert Kirkman
item.description: An in-depth chat with The Walking Dead creator Robert Kirkman (Invincible; Super Dinosaur; Thief of Thieves) about the formation of his Skybound imprint at Image Comics, his process for breaking story, choices he's made for his characters, zombies vs. walkers, and lots more.

item.title: American Horror Story: Asylum in review!
item.description:
American Horror Story: Asylum in review! Executive producer Tim Minear and co-exec producers Jennifer Salt, and Jessica Sharzer on the incredible second season of the FX horror-drama-comedy-musical (“The Name Game?”), what went right and wrong, a look inside the writers' room, and what's next.

Recorded January 24, 2013.

item.title: Marlon Wayans
item.description: Marlon Wayans. Recorded January 16th, 2013

item.title: BJ Novak, Elaine Ko and Kevin Shinick
item.description: BJ Novak (The Office); Elaine Ko (Modern Family; Family Guy); and Kevin Shinick (developer, MAD; Robot Chicken). Recorded November 11, 2012.

item.title: 2012 in review, part 2!
item.description: 2012 in review, part 2! Join some MORE of our favorite panelists—Join some MORE of our favorite panelists—Aaron Ginsburg (Do No Harm; Finder) and John Ross Bowie (from Big Bang Theory, who sold two pilots this year)—as they talk about what they learned this year, what a strange year it was, and what they're looking forward to in 2013. Recorded December 5, 2012.

item.title: 2012 in review, part 1
item.description: 2012 in review, part 1! Join some of our favorite panelists—Josh Friedman (creator, Sarah Connor Chronicles), Andrew Miller (creator, Secret Circle), and Cathryn Humphris (Ringer; Mob Doctor)—as they talk about what they learned this year, what a strange year it was, and what they're looking forward to in 2013. Recorded December 5, 2012.

item.title: Man of Action Studios!
item.description: An in-depth chat with the creators of Ben 10 and Generator Rex and the developers of Ultimate Spider-Man and the upcoming Avengers Assemble cartoons. Also accomplished comic book writers and artists, Man of Action is Steven T. Seagle, Duncan Rouleau, and Joe Casey (and Joe Kelly, who unfortunately could not join). Recorded November 4, 2012.

item.title: Pendleton Ward, Martin Gero and Kent Osborne
item.description: Pendleton Ward (creator, Adventure Time); Martin Gero (creator, The LA Complex); Kent Osborne (head writer, Adventure Time; Spongebob; Flapjack). Recorded October 21, 2012.

item.title: Live from NY!
item.description: Live from NY! Bill Hader (Saturday Night Live; South Park) and Peter David (comic books! Including X-Factor, Supergirl, 12 years on Incredible Hulk, and lots more). Recorded at 61Local in Brooklyn on October 1, 2012.

item.title: Not My Bag
item.description: Comic books! Celebrating the release of Not My Bag, the new graphic novel by Sina Grace (former editor of The Walking Dead; artist of The Li'l Depressed Boy and Amber Benson's Among the Ghosts). Plus comics writers Gerry Duggan (Deadpool), James Asmus (Gambit; Thief of Thieves), and Blair Butler (HEART; Attack of the Show!). Recorded October 18, 2012.

item.title: Live from Brooklyn!
item.description:
Live from Brooklyn! Some of the funniest people in NY. Joe Randazzo (former editor of The Onion); Caissie St. Onge (Best Week Ever; Rosie O'Donnell; Letterman); Stephen Falk (Weeds; Next Caller); Matt Debenham (author, The Book of Right and Wrong). Follow them on Twitter: @Randazzoj, @Caissie, @StephenFalk, @Debenham. You won't be sorry.

Recorded at 61Local in Brooklyn on October 1, 2012.

item.title: Jeff Eastin, Lauren Hissrich and Victor Fresco
item.description: Jeff Eastin (creator, White Collar and Graceland); Lauren Hissrich (The West Wing, Justice) Victor Fresco (creator, Andy Richter Controls the Universe, Better Off Ted, The Trouble with Normal); Recorded October 14, 2012.

item.title: Iain Morris, Fred Stoller, Charlie Grandy and Amy Ozols
item.description:
Iain Morris (co-creator, The Inbetweeners [UK]; Flight of the Conchords); Fred Stoller (Seinfeld; Handy Manny); Charlie Grandy (The Daily Show; co-creator, Guys with Kids); Amy Ozols (Late Night with Jimmy Fallon; co-creator, Guys with Kids).
Recorded September 16, 2012.

item.title: Mad Men season five in review!
item.description: Mad Men season five in review! Creator/showrunner Matthew Weiner, showrunners Andre and Maria Jacquemetton, and writer Erin Levy give their take on the AMC series' fifth season, choices they made about the characters, audience expectations, collaboration, and absolutely no spoilers about season six! Mad Mens season five is released on DVD on 10/16.

item.title: “Why Aren't More People Talking About These Awesome Shows?”
item.description:
The “Why Aren't More People Talking About These Awesome Shows?” panel, featuring Awkward. creator Lauren Iungerich and Parenthood/Friday Night Lights writer David Hudgins. We also brought back our old pals Josh Friedman (creator, The Sarah Connor Chronicles) and Jeff Greenstein (Will and Grace; Husbands; co-creator, Partners [1995 version]) to talk about TV they love which is overlooked or underrated.

Recorded August 26, 2012.

item.title: An Evening with Ed Brubaker
item.description: Comic book writer/creator of Fatale, Criminal, Captain America, and more. Topics discussed include the “rules of comic book writing,” the state of Marvel and DC and its creators, film adaptations of comics, and Ed's TV pitches. Recorded June 22, 2012.

item.title: Key and Peele
item.description: Creators/writers/stars of Comedy Central's Key and Peele: Keegan-Michael Key, Jordan Peele, showrunner Ian Roberts, Rebecca Drysdale, Colton Dunn, Charlie Sanders, Rich Talarico, and Alex Rubens. A really fun chat with some really funny people. The new season of Key and Peele starts Sept 26th, right after South Park! Recorded August 19, 2012.

item.title: Jonathan Katz and Tom Snyder
item.description:
An in-depth chat Jonathan Katz and Tom Snyder, co-creators of Dr. Katz, Professional Therapist. We talk about that watershed show for Comedy Central, as well as the Snyder-produced Home Movies, “Squiggle-vision,” Katz's stand-up and the WB sitcom he created starring Bob Saget, and Katz and Snyder's latest collaboration, Explosion Bus, which can be seen at http://www.explosionbus.com/ (the new season of which begins Sept 18).

Enormous thanks to Tom Wickersham, of Katz's team, who tracked me down while I was in Boston and arranged this interview before anyone could decline.

item.title: Breaking Bad Season Five in Review
item.description:
Breaking Bad season five in review! Showrunner/creator Vince Gilligan and writers Peter Gould, Sam Catlin, George Mastras, Gennifer Hutchison, Thomas Schnauz, Moira Walley-Beckett and Gordon Smith talk about their take on the AMC series' fifth season. Spoilers contained herein!

Recorded September 5, 2012.

item.title: Stages of TV Writer
item.description: The "Stages of TV Writer" panel from the ATX Television Festival: Noah Hawley (creator, the Unusuals); Kyle Killen (creator, Awake and Lone Star); David Hudgins (Friday Night Lights; Parenthood); Hardy Janson and Evan Miller (Hook Ups). Recorded June 2, 2012.

item.title: Andrew Bujalski
item.description: An in depth chat with Andrew Bujalski, writer-director of such films as Funny Ha-Ha (forerunner of the so-called “mumblecore” movement), Mutual Appreciation, Beeswax, and the upcoming Computer Chess. Recorded June 7, 2012.

item.title: Book to TV Series
item.description: “Book to TV Series” panel from the ATX Television Festival. David Hudgins (Friday Night Lights); Bob Levy (Alloy Entertainment: The Lying Game, The Vampire Diaries, Gossip Girl); Julie Plec (co-creator, The Vampire Diaries); Michael Rauch (creator, Love Monkey). Moderated by Meg Masters of TVLine. Recorded June 2, 2012.

item.title: TV Fantasy Goes Mainstream
item.description: “TV Fantasy Goes Mainstream” panel from the ATX Television Festival. Jeff Davis (creator, Teen Wolf and Criminal Minds); Jane Espenson (Once Upon a Time; Husbands; BSG; Buffy); Richard Hatem (creator, Miracles; Grimm); Jose Molina (Firefly; Terra Nova; Vampire Diaries); Ben Edlund (creator, The Tick; Firefly; Supernatural). Recorded June 2, 2012.

item.title: “Women on TV” panel from the ATX
item.description: “Women on TV” panel from the ATX Television Festival. Jane Espenson (Once Upon a Time; Husbands; BSG; Buffy); Liz Tigelaar (Nashville; Revenge; creator, Life Unexpected); Erica Messer (showrunner, Criminal Minds). Moderated by Meg Masters of TVLine. Recorded June 2, 2012.

item.title: Animation Celebration!
item.description: Animation celebration! Swampy Marsh & Dan Povenmire (creators, Phineas & Ferb); Meghan McCarthy (head writer, My Little Pony; Class of 3000); Tim McKeon (Adventure Time; Fish Hooks). Recorded May 6, 2012.

item.title: “Creators” Panel from the ATX Television Festival
item.description: “Creators” panel from the ATX Television Festival. Noah Hawley (creator, the Unusuals); Kyle Killen (creator, Awake and Lone Star); Kevin Biegel (co-creator, Cougar Town), Mark Schwahn (creator, One Tree Hill), Liz Tigelaar (creator, Life Unexpected). Moderated by Jordan Levin (former CEO, the WB; co-founder, Generate; Alloy Ent.). Recorded June 2, 2012.

item.title: Len Wein, Ed Brubaker and Jackson Publick
item.description: Comic books and cartoons! With Len Wein (creator of Wolverine, Swamp Thing, Human Target, and tons more); Ed Brubaker (Fatale; Criminal; Sleeper; Captain America); and Jackson Publick (co-creator, The Venture Brothers). Recorded April 29, 2012.

item.title: “The Javi Games”
item.description:
“The Javi Games”: an evening spent in the garrulous company of The Middle Man creator, Lost and Charlie's Angels writer Javier Grillo Marxuatch. Includes discussion of his new comic book, Ramiel: Wrath of God and his short film, Reverse Parthenogenesis, which you can see here: http://web.me.com/chaodai/Reverse_Parthenogenesis/Introduction.html

For discussion of the film we're joined by its stars, Amber Benson and Adam Busch (both of Buffy the Vampire Slayer), and Edmund Lupinski. Recorded April 23, 2012.

item.title: Andrew Miller, Chic Eglee & the return of Dana Gould
item.description: Andrew Miller (creator, The Secret Circle); Chic Eglee (adapter of Bendis' Powers for FX; co-creator, Dark Angel; Walking Dead; The Shield); and the return of Dana Gould (comedy!; the Simpsons). Recorded April 22, 2012.

item.title: Shawn Ryan, Cheo Hodari Coker & Amy Berg
item.description: Shawn Ryan (creator, The Shield, Chicago Code, and Last Resort); Cheo Hodari Coker (Southland; Notorious), and the return of Amy Berg (Eureka; Person of Interest). Recorded April 15, 2012.

item.title: Pilot season wrap-up with Alexa Junge, Andrew Miller and Josh Friedman
item.description: Pilot season wrap-up with Alexa Junge (exec-producer of 2012 series Save Me; Friends), Andrew Miller (Secret Circle), and Josh Friedman (Sarah Connor Chronicles; 2012 pilot The Asset). Recorded June 6, 2012.

item.title: Graham Yost
item.description: An in depth chat with Justified creator Graham Yost about his journey from Speed to From the Earth to the Moon, Band of Brothers, and The Pacific to Boomtown to translating Elmore Leonard's worldview to the small screen. Great advice about seeing through your characters' perspectives, world-building, and creating memorable supporting characters.

item.title: Neil Goldman, Aisha Muharrar & Dailyn Rodriguez
item.description: Neil Goldman (Community; Scrubs; Ben & Kate); Aisha Muharrar (Parks & Recreation); Dailyn Rodriguez (Lie to Me; The Glades). Recorded May 20, 2012.

item.title: Andrew W. Marlowe, Tim Long & Terri Miller
item.description: Andrew W. Marlowe (creator, Castle); Tim Long (The Simpsons); Terri Miller (Castle). Recorded April 1, 2012.

item.title: The Walking Dead season two in review!
item.description: Showrunner Glen Mazzara and writers Scott Gimple and Angela Kang talk about their take on the AMC series' second season, characters' goals both immediate and emotional, audience expectations, hot zombie action, and some choice tidbits about season three!

item.title: Jane Espenson and Douglas Petrie
item.description: Jane Espenson (Once Upon a Time; Husbands; Buffy; Caprica) and Douglas Petrie (Charlie's Angels; Buffy; Pushing Daisies) return to the studio to revisit Jane's old blog, janeespenson.com, and discuss how, while the business may have changed since she was regularly updating it, writing has not. Plus: Who is Ty Cashman?

item.title: Bill Lawrence, Ken Levine & Richard Hatem
item.description: Bill Lawrence (creator, Scrubs and Cougartown); Ken Levine (MASH; Cheers; Wings; Fraser; The Simpsons); Richard Hatem (Grimm; Secret Circle). Recorded March 25, 2012.

item.title: John Hurwitz and Hayden Schlossberg
item.description: An in depth interview with John Hurwitz and Hayden Schlossberg, the writers of the Harold and Kumar movies and American Reunion, the new sequel to American Pie.

item.title: Creators of Adult Swim's Eagleheart
item.description: The brains behind Adult Swim's Eagleheart, writer/creators Michael Koman and Andrew Weinberg and director Jason Woliner, sit down to talk about comedy, the learning curve of the show's first season,  working with Chris Elliott, and lots more. A really fun chat.

item.title: Winnie Holzman, Matt Selman & Paul Grellong
item.description: Winnie Holzman (creator, My So-Called Life; Thirtysomething); Matt Selman (The Simpsons); Paul Grellong (Terra Nova; Law and Order: SVU). Recorded March 11, 2012.

item.title: Damon Lindelof
item.description: An in depth chat with Lost co-creator Damon Lindelof about comics, Star Wars, sequels, Star Trek,  JJ Abrams, fandom... everything you want a Damon Lindelof to talk about.

item.title: Maurissa Tancharoen & Jed Whedon, Tami Sagher & Eliza Clark
item.description: Maurissa Tancharoen and Jed Whedon (Spartacus; Dr. Horrible); Tami Sagher (30 Rock; How I Met Your Mother); Eliza Clark (Rubicon; The Killing). Recorded February 12, 2012.

item.title: Vince Gilligan
item.description: An in-depth chat with Breaking Bad creator Vince Gilligan. Vince is candid and thoughtful about his past experiences (including seven years on the X-Files), creating complex characters, and the importance of collaboration.

item.title: Dana Gould, Liz Tigelaar & Robert Hewitt Wolfe
item.description: Dana Gould (The Simpsons); Liz Tigelaar (creator, Life Unexpected); Robert Hewitt Wolfe (Alphas). Recorded January 15, 2012.

item.title: Vince Gilligan, Julie Plec, the return of Josh Friedman & Jeff Greenstein
item.description: Vince Gilligan (creator, Breaking Bad); Julie Plec (developer, Vampire Diaries); the return of Josh Friedman (developer, Sarah Connor Chronicles) and Jeff Greenstein (Desperate Housewives; Will and Grace). Recorded January 20, 2012.

item.title: Writers/creators/stars of Childrens Hospital and NTSF:SD:SUV: Rob Corddry, Paul Scheer, Jon Stern, Curtis Gwinn, David Wain, Ken Marino, Erica Oyama, and Rob Huebel
item.description: Writers/creators/stars of Childrens Hospital and NTSF:SD:SUV: Rob Corddry, Paul Scheer, Jon Stern, Curtis Gwinn, David Wain, Ken Marino, Erica Oyama, and Rob Huebel. Recorded December 11, 2011.

item.title: Marti Noxon, Danny Zuker & Craig Silverstein
item.description: Marti Noxon (Buffy; Glee); Danny Zuker (Modern Family); Craig Silverstein (creator, Nikita; co-creator Terra Nova). Recorded November 20, 2011.

item.title: Josh Berman, Leigh Dana Jackson & Adam Glass
item.description: Josh Berman (creator, Drop Dead Diva); Leigh Dana Jackson (Alcatraz; No Ordinary Family); Adam Glass (Supernatural). Recorded November 13, 2011.

item.title: Adam Rogers
item.description:
An enlightening chat with Adam Rogers, a senior editor at Wired magazine. Ben Acker sits in too, as we discuss magazine writing and editing and how it differs from television production, the state and future of both industries, and lots more. Recorded January 20, 2012.

For part one of this interview, visit http://downloads.wired.com/podcasts/xml/Storyboard.xml or download the Wired Storyboard podcast on iTunes.

item.title: Liz Meriwether, Liz Craft and Sarah Fain & Angela Kang
item.description: Liz Meriwether (creator, The New Girl); Liz Craft and Sarah Fain (Vampire Diaries; Dollhouse); Angela Kang (The Walking Dead; Terriers). Recorded October 23, 2011.

item.title: Dan Harmon, Kyle Killen, Chris McKenna & Charles Murray
item.description: Dan Harmon (Community creator’s return engagement!); Kyle Killen (creator, Lone Star; co-creator Awake); Chris McKenna (Community; American Dad); Charles Murray (Castle; V; Criminal Minds). Recorded October 16, 2011.

item.title: Hart Hanson, Jose Molina & Sarah Goldfinger
item.description: Hart Hanson (creator, Bones and The Finder); Jose Molina (Terra Nova; Angel; Firefly); Sarah Goldfinger (CSI; Grimm). Recorded November 6, 2011.

item.title: Ben Acker, Aaron Ginsburg and Wade McIntyre
item.description: A 2011 round-up about what we learned this year and the state of the industry with Ben Acker (Supernatural), Aaron Ginsburg and Wade McIntyre (The Finder).

item.title: David Fury
item.description: An in depth chat with David Fury (Buffy; Angel; 24; Lost; Fringe) about his career, process, and the choices he's made.

item.title: Zack Whedon, Jeremy Carver & John Rogers
item.description: Zack Whedon (Fringe; Deadwood; Rubicon); Jeremy Carver (developer, Being Human); John Rogers (creator, Leverage). Recorded September 25, 2011.

item.title: Ed Kitsis & Adam Horowitz, Eric Charmelo & Nicole Snyder
item.description: Ed Kitsis & Adam Horowitz (creators, Once Upon a Time); Eric Charmelo & Nicole Snyder (creators, Ringer). Recorded September 18, 2011.

item.title: Naren Shankar, Bradley Thompson and David Weddle & Meredith Stiehm
item.description: Naren Shankar (Star Trek DS9; CSI; Grimm); Bradley Thompson and David Weddle (Battlestar Galactica; Falling Skies); Meredith Stiehm (creator, Cold Case). Recorded July 31, 2011.

item.title: Bob Odenkirk, Jen Kirkman & Brian Stack
item.description: Bob Odenkirk (co-creator, Mr. Show); Jen Kirkman (Chelsea Lately); Brian Stack (Conan). Guest-moderated by comic book and animation writer Adam Beechen!

item.title: Glen Mazzara, David Slack & Norm Hiscock
item.description: Glen Mazzara (The Walking Dead); David Slack (Person of Interest); Norm Hiscock (Parks and Recreation). Recorded July 17, 2011.

item.title: Steven S. DeKnight, Tim Minear, Megan Ganz & Harris Wittels
item.description: Steven S. DeKnight (creator, Spartacus; Buffy; Angel); Tim Minear (Angel; Firefly; American Horror Story); Megan Ganz (Community); Harris Wittels (Parks and Recreation). Recorded June 19, 2011.

item.title: Allan Loeb & Phoef Sutton & Rob Roy Thomas
item.description: Allan Loeb (creator,New Amsterdam; Wall Street: Money Never Sleeps); Phoef Sutton (Terriers; Cheers); Rob Roy Thomas (creator, Free Ride). Recorded March 6, 2011.

item.title: Steve Levitan, Rob Thomas & John Enbom
item.description: Steve Levitan (co-creator, Modern Family); Rob Thomas (creator, Veronica Mars); John Enbom (co-creator, Party Down; developer, Free Agents). Recorded March 20, 2011.

item.title: Peter Gould, Kerry Ehrin & Bridget Carpenter
item.description: Peter Gould (Breaking Bad); Kerry Ehrin (Friday Night Lights); Bridget Carpenter (Friday Night Lights; Dead Like Me). Recorded August 21, 2011.

item.title: Alan Yang, Michael Taylor, Genny Hutchison & Ryan Farley
item.description: Alan Yang (Parks and Recreation); Michael Taylor (Battlestar Galactica); Genny Hutchison (Breaking Bad); Ryan Farley (Justified). Recorded August 14, 2011.

item.title: Amy Berg, Ben Edlund & Angelina Burnett
item.description: Amy Berg (Eureka); Ben Edlund (The Tick; Angel; Supernatural); Angelina Burnett (Boss; Memphis Beat). Recorded June 12, 2011.

item.title: Creators and cast of the web-series Husbands (HusbandsTheSeries.com)
item.description: 7- Creators and cast of the web-series Husbands (HusbandsTheSeries.com): co-writer/executive producer Jane Espenson (Buffy; Caprica; Torchwood), director Jeff Greenstein (Will & Grace; Desperate Housewives), co-writer/actor Brad "Cheeks" Bell, actor Alessandra Torresani (Caprica), and actor Sean Hemeon. Recorded September 11, 2011.

item.title: Matt Nix, Peter Tolan & David Schulner
item.description: Matt Nix (Burn Notice); Peter Tolan (Rescue Me); David Schulner (The Event). Recorded April 20, 2011.

item.title: Douglas Petrie, Alexa Junge, Josh Friedman & Michael Green
item.description: Douglas Petrie (Buffy; CSI); Alexa Junge (Friends; United States of Tara); Josh Friedman (Sarah Connor Chronicles); Michael Green (Heroes; Kings; Green Lantern film). Recorded May 29, 2011.

item.title: Veena Sud, Gary Lennon, Sarah Watson & Bob Kushell
item.description: Veena Sud (The Killing); Gary Lennon (Justified); Sarah Watson (Parenthood); Bob Kushell (3rd Rock from the Sun). Recorded May 15, 2011.

item.title: Dan Harmon, Javier Grillo Marxuach, Aaron Ginsburg & Wade McIntyre
item.description: Dan Harmon (Community); Javier Grillo Marxuach (The Middle Man; Lost); Aaron Ginsburg and Wade McIntyre (The Good Guys; Finder). Recorded April 27, 2011.

item.title: David Fury, Jeff Greenstein, Emily Cutler, & Cathryn Humphries
item.description: David Fury (Buffy; Angel; Lost; 24); Jeff Greenstein (Friends; Will & Grace; Desperate Housewives); Emily Cutler (Community); Cathryn Humphries (Mad Men; V). Recorded March 13, 2011.

item.title: Damon LIndelof, Jane Espenson, Erin Levy & Drew Z. Greenberg
item.description: Damon Lindelof (Lost); Jane Espenson (Buffy; Battlestar Galactica; Torchwood); Erin Levy (Mad Men); Drew Z. Greenberg (Buffy; Warehouse 13). Recorded March 27, 2011.
